description:
The NeonSelect is the equivalent of an HTML <select> form control. On touch devices NeonSelect will use the native select for input. NeonSelect supports grouping and multiselect.

Note: As well as the options described below, pass through attributes supported by NeonDropdown to change the style of the dropdown button.

props.name: placeholder
props.description: Placeholder to display as button label when there is no option selected.

props.name: placeholderAsOption
props.description: Display the placeholder as the first option in the select, this is useful as an alternative to a label.

props.name: options
props.description: A list of options to render in the select.

props.name: groupedOptions
props.description: A list of grouped options to render in the select.

props.name: modelValue
props.description:
Either a single string, indicating the key of the selected option or an array of selected keys in the case
multiple = true.

props.name: multiselectPlaceholder
props.description: Placeholder when multiple values are selected.

props.name: size
props.description: The size of the dropdown - Small, Medium or Large.

events.name: update:modelValue
events.description: emitted when the user changes the selection.

slots.name: option
slots.description:
provide a custom template for an option.
Bindings: option
